comments:
The help browser starts, but won't serve any help files. Instead the
message "The document that you have requested is not available. The
link may be wrong, or you may not have the corresponding product feature
installed."

This happens with Eclipse 3.0.1, 3.0.2 and 3.1M5, all with a fresh
jdk 1.5.0_02 from sun. The tomcat server seems to be running -- it is
listening on its assigned port and responds to http requests from an
external browers (respond in the sense of returning the above message).
This happens whether the port/address is selected by eclipse or set by
the user. 

It happens when either opera or MSIE are the system default browser (both
in "online" mode). 

No firewall, online virus scanning, or ad/spy-ware blocking progams are
active (although McAfee VirusScan Enterprise 8.0.0 is installed).

It seems unlikely that the files were corrupted on download -- the md5sums
match and the rest of Eclipse appears functional. The file protections
also appear correct.

I suppose it is possible that there is some java security setting causing 
the, but I get the same results if I start eclipse via eclipse.exe (and
therefore routed the java control panel settings) or run javaw from the
jdk explicitly. In any event, it is a fresh java installation with the 
current version from Sun, and eclipse fails to work.

There is nothing in the main eclipse log file, however in
...\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.tomcat\catalina.2005-03-25.log
there is:

SecureRandom
